title: 2025 Halloween Events & Trunk - Or - Treats Across Eastern Iowa
body_text:
2025 Halloween Events & Trunk-Or-Treats Across Eastern Iowa [LIST BY COUNTY]
Things are getting SPOOKY here in Eastern Iowa! Here's a list of Halloween-themed events happening across the region in October of 2025. They are broken down by county (in alphabetical order).
*Looking for other October events across Eastern Iowa? Click HERE!*
Get our free mobile app
BENTON COUNTY
An Evening of Hocus Pocus
- Bloomsbury Farm, Atkins
- Friday, October 3rd from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m.
- Featuring an outdoor movie showing, photos with the Sanderson Sisters, a beer & wine garden, and access to fall farm activities until 5:30 p.m.
- Purchase tickets HERE
Trick or Treat
- Dollar Fresh Market, Vinton
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
- "Bring the kids to your local Dollar Fresh Market to celebrate Halloween with candy, costumes, and spooky fun"
Halloween Party
- Schroeder/Keystone Public Library, Keystone
- Wednesday, October 29th from 5:30 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- Featuring games, prizes, snacks, crafts, and more
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- Parkers Grove Baptist Church, Shellsburg
- Sunday, October 26th from 4 p.m. to 5:30 p.m.
- City Park, Atkins
- Sunday, October 26th from 2 p.m. to 3:30 p.m.
- Main Street, Garrison
- Friday, October 31st from 5 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.
BLACK HAWK COUNTY
Downtown Historic Haunted Tours
- Downtown Waterloo
- Dates/Times
- Wednesday, October 8th at 7 p.m.
- October 9th through 11th at 6 p.m. & 8 p.m.
- "Explore the dark side of Historic Downtown Waterloo and learn about haunted happenings, dark history, local folklore, and more as you walk with us into the realm of mystery and suspense."
- Ages 18+
- Purchase tickets HERE
Strolling with the Spirits
- Fairview Cemetery, Waterloo
- Saturday, October 11th at 3 p.m., 7 p.m., & 10 p.m.
- "As dusk falls, the past comes to life—walk among the headstones and meet costumed actors who embody the lives (and deaths) of Waterloo’s most intriguing historical figures. Hear their eerie tales, whispered from beyond the grave, as you stand beside their final resting places. History has never been so haunting… or so alive."
- Purchase tickets HERE
The Addams Family
- Gallagher Bluedorn Performing Arts Center, Cedar Falls
- October 17 & 18th at 7 p.m.
- Purchase tickets HERE
Family Halloween Safety Event
- Angels Park, Evansdale
- Saturday, October 18th from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m.
- "Fingerprint/DNA Kits, FUN while learning safety from firefighters, Police Officers and others, Trunk or Treat, free pumpkins, free fitted bicycle helmets (while supplies last), Kids fun zone with games & prizes, free food and a chance to win a bike and other prizes."
Starbite Halloween Themed Planetarium Show
- Grout Museum, Waterloo
- Friday, October 24th at 6 p.m., 7 p.m., 8 p.m., & 9 p.m.
- "Join us—if you dare—for an adults-only Halloween planetarium show that explores the darker side of the cosmos. From ghostly galaxies and cursed constellations to local hauntings and spine-chilling ghost stories, this immersive experience will leave you both awestruck and uneasy. The veil between science and the supernatural grows thin. Space is dark… but some places are darker than others."
- Purchase tickets HERE
Grout Spooktacular
- Grout Museum, Waterloo
- Saturday, October 25th from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "Wear your costumes and trick-o-treat around the Grout Museum for FREE candy! Enjoy Halloween themed games and so much more."
- Event is free - museum donations will be accepted
Downtown Trick-or-Treat
- Downtown Waterloo
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.
- "Join us in celebrating Halloween with Downtown Trick-or-Treating, which features entertaining activities, games, and, of course, candy."
Trick or Treat at Hy-Vee
- Locations
- Flammang Dr, Waterloo
- Ansborough Ave, Waterloo
- University Ave, Cedar Falls
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Harvest Festival
- Zion Lutheran Church, Hudson
- Saturday, October 25th from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.
- Featuring trunk-or-treating, games, a photo booth, and food for purchase
Witches' Hallow
- Cedar Valley Arboretum & Botanic Gardens, Waterloo
- Sunday, October 26th from 11:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.
- "Join us at the Cedar Valley Arboretum for a family-friendly Halloween celebration full of spooky fun, dancing, crafts, trick-or-treating, and even broomstick activities!"
- LIMITED CAPACITY - first 100 kids
- Admission is $5 for ages 5 to 17
Trick or Treat: Fright Night at the Phelps
- Waterloo Center for the Arts
- Wednesday, October 29th from 5:30 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "Wear your costumes as you play your way to the answer of our riddle, make Halloween crafts, and win prizes."
- Cost is $10 - must register by October 24th
Hudson Business Boo
- Downtown Hudson
- Thursday, October 30th from 4 p.m. to 5 p.m.
- "Hudson businesses will be open or set up along the street to give out treats to our little trick or treaters. The road will be closed during this time. Get dressed up and come join the local businesses!"
ReStore Haunted Birthday Bash
- Habitat for Humanity ReStore, Waterloo
- Friday, October 31st from 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.
- Featuring costumes, trunk-or-treat, food trucks, games, raffle prizes, and more
Drop-In Trick-or-Treating and Halloween Crafts
- Evansdale Public Library
- Friday, October 31st from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m.
Halloween Candy Buyback
- All Smiles Family Dentistry, Cedar Falls
- Monday, November 3rd from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- "Bring your extra Halloween candy to trade for cash, prizes, and smiles! Let’s keep those teeth healthy while supporting a great cause — all candy will be donated to Treats for Troops. The more you bring, the more you earn — and it’s open to all kids in the community!"
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- Cedar Falls AMVETS Post 49
- Saturday, October 25th from 12 p.m. to 1:30 p.m.
- Capri College, Waterloo
- Wednesday, October 29th from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- Allen College, Waterloo
- Thursday, October 30th from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- La Cava Mexican Bar and Grill, Waterloo
- Friday, October 31st from 5:30 p.m. to 8 p.m.
BREMER COUNTY
Trick or Treat at Hy-Vee
- 4th St SW, Waverly
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Haunted Hayride
- Bremer County Fairgrounds, Waverly
- Saturday, October 25th from 6 p.m. to 11 p.m.
- Family-Friendly Ride from 6 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- "Guests will board wagons and ride through a looping path filled with 8 themed scare stations, each brought to life by local groups, clubs, and businesses."
- Also featuring food trucks
- Cost is $ for ages 12 and under and $10 for ages 13+
Llamaween Open Farm
- 2671 Killdeer Ave, Denver
- Sunday, October 26th from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.
- Featuring hayrides, a spooky barn, a concession stand, a scavenger hunt, a photo booth, and more
- Admission is a donation (money or non-perishable food items) to the Northeast Iowa Food Bank
Jack-O-Lantern Night
- Downtown Waverly
- Thursday, October 30th from 6 p.m. to 7:30 p.m.
- "The Waverly Chamber invites all the little ghosts and goblins to join the fun and fill their bags with treats provided by participating downtown merchants during Waverly’s annual Jack-O-Lantern Night"
BUCHANAN COUNTY
Boo Bash
- Falcon Civic Center, Independence
- Friday, October 24th from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- "All ages can drop in to enjoy games, crafts, face painting, prizes, and a photo booth to celebrate Halloween. Wear your costume to the Falcon Center and carve out time to have some Halloween fun!"
Trick or Treat
- Dollar Fresh Market, Independence
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
Trick-or-Treat at BCHC
- Buchanan County Health Center, Independence
- Friday, October 31st from 5 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.
BUTLER COUNTY
Outdoor Movie Night Double Feature
- Kothe Memorial - Parkersburg Public Library, Parkersburg
- Saturday, October 4th at 6:30 p.m.
- Showing Goosebumps at 6:30 p.m. and Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark at 8:30 p.m.
- Popcorn/snacks are provided - reserve seating is available
Community Trick-or-Treat
- Rehabilitation Center of Allison
- Friday, October 31st from 4 p.m. to 5 p.m.
Trick-or-Treating
- Shell Rock Senior Living, Shell Rock
- Friday, October 31st from 4 p.m. to 5:30 p.m.
Halloween S'mores & Popcorn in the Park
- Aplington City Park
- Friday, October 31st from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m.
CHICKASAW COUNTY
PumpkinFest
- The Cottage at Woodland Farm, Fredericksburg
- Sunday, October 19th from 2 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- Featuring hayrides, a petting zoo, face painting, games, crafts, a barn dance, a food truck, and more
Trick or Treat
- Upham Memorial Library
- Friday, October 31st from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
CLAYTON COUNTY
Ghost Stories by the Campfire at Spook Cave
- Spook Cave and Campground, McGregor
- Friday, October 3rd at 7:30 p.m.
- Hosted by Kelly and Chris Nielson of Travelers Moon
- "This isn’t a stiff lecture or a stage show. It’s us, a fire, and whoever wants to gather around while we share some of our favorite ghost stories, talk about the history behind the places we’ve investigated, and answer whatever questions you’ve been dying to ask about the paranormal."
Witches Night Out
- Keystone Park, Elkader
- Thursday, October 9th from 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. (registration until 6 p.m.)
- Featuring prizes/giveaways and a costume contest: Best Individual, Best Group, Best Kiddo
Strawberry Point Pumpkin Walk
- Downtown Strawberry Point
- Saturday, October 25th from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.
- Featuring trick-or-treating, Halloween games, a costume parade, the BIG Pumpkin Drop, a craft & vendor show, and food
Business Trick-or-Treating
- Main Street, Elkader
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.
CLINTON COUNTY
Scream for Steam
- Vince Jetter Community Center, Clinton
- Saturday, October 11th from 12 p.m. to 2:30 p.m.
- Featuring pumpkin decorating, snacks, games, and more
Haunted Wine Walk
- Deja Vu Furniture and Accessories, Clinton
- Thursday, October 16th from 4 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "—a wicked evening of wine slushies, Halloween vibes, and seriously stylish shopping. Costumes are highly encouraged, so grab your ghouls, throw on your best witchy wear, and sip while you shop our eerie-sistible collection of Halloween décor and fall finds. Whether you're haunting the town with friends or creeping solo, this event is free to attend and open to the 21+ crowd."
Sawmill Halloween Party
- The Sawmill Museum, Clinton
- Saturday, October 18th from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.
- Featuring costumes, games, photo ops, and a "tasty activity"
- Included with regular museum admission
Ghost Tours of the George M. Curtis Mansion
- George M. Curtis House, Clinton
- Sunday, October 19th at 6 p.m.
- "...guests will get to learn about the history of the Women's Club, history for the mansion itself, and the guests that still reside within."
- Tickets are $20
Trick or Treat
- Downtown Clinton
- Friday, October 24th from 3 p.m. to 5 p.m.
Trick or Treat at Hy-Vee
- 4th St, Clinton
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Dusk To Dawn Horror Movie Marathon
- Voy 61 Drive In Theatre, Delmar
- Saturday, October 25th at 6:30 p.m.
- Showing The Exorcist, The Conjuring, The Conjuring 2, and Nightmare on Elm Street
- Featuring a full concession stand and free breakfast in the morning
- Tickets are $25
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- Clinton Municipal Airport
- Saturday, October 18th from 3:30 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- Voy 61 Drive In Theatre, Delmar
- Friday, October 24th at 5:30 p.m.
- Ketelsen RV, DeWitt
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
- Pizza Ranch, Clinton
- Wednesday, October 29th from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
DELAWARE COUNTY
A Paranormal Investigation
- Delaware County Historical Museum, Hopkinton
- Saturday, October 11th from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. & 7 p.m. to 11 p.m.
- Purchase tickets HERE
Halloween Party
- Delhi Public Library
- Saturday, October 25th from 9:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- Sherman's Pumpkin Farm and Corn Maze, Manchester
- Sunday, October 26th from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.
- Edgewood-Colesburg Elementary School, Colesburg
- Sunday, October 26th from 4:30 p.m. to 6 p.m.
DES MOINES COUNTY
Big Holloween
- Big Hollow Creek Recreation Area, Mediapolis
- Saturday, October 11th from 4:30 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- "Come celebrate Halloween in the Campground! This all-ages public event will feature trick-or-treating among the participating RV's and costume contests. You do not have to camp at the park to participate."
Witches Night Out
- Downtown Burlington
- Friday, October 17th from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "Witches Night Out is a festive evening celebrating Downtown Burlington’s retailers, eateries, and drinkeries with a mapped stroll of participating locations. Attendees can expect seasonal samples, special offers, and fun giveaways at stops throughout the district."
- Register HERE
The Rocky Horror Picture Show
- The Capitol Theater, Burlington
- Saturday, October 18th at 10 p.m.
- Featuring adult beverages and costumes
- Ages 18+
- Tickets are $15 per person and include a prop bag - purchase them HERE
Downtown Trick-or-Treat
- Downtown Burlington
- Friday, October 25th from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- "Bring your ghouls, goblins, princesses, and superheroes to Downtown Burlington for a safe, family-friendly night of trick-or-treating! Stroll the bricks, visit participating businesses, and fill those candy buckets while enjoying the magic of our historic downtown."
Trick-or-Main Street
- Main Street, Mediapolis
- Thursday, October 30th from 5:30 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- "Main Street will transform into a Halloween haunt, where kids and families can safely "trick-or-treat" at participating businesses."
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- 34 Raceway, West Burlington (Drive-Thru Event)
- Saturday, October 11th from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.
- The Salvation Army, Burlington
- Friday, October 17th from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- Bare Faced Rejuvenation Lounge, Burlington
- Friday, October 24th from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- Heartland Harley Davidson, Burlington
- Saturday, October 25th from 12 p.m. to 2 p.m.
- Burlington Area YMCA
- Thursday, October 30th from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.
DUBUQUE COUNTY
The Rocky Horror Picture Show 50th Anniversary
- Phoenix Theatres Kennedy Mall, Dubuque
- October 3rd, 4th, 10th, & 11th
- Purchase tickets HERE
Pumpkin Palooza Day
- Goose & Giggles Play Cafe, Dubuque
- Saturday, October 4th from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m.
- Featuring pumpkin sensory bins, games, story time, a pumpkin painting station, and more
- Purchase tickets HERE
Ghouls in the Gardens: A Movie Under the Stars
- Dubuque Arboretum & Botanical Gardens
- Friday, October 10th from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m.
- "The fun begins at 6 PM with a kid's costume contest, candy for the kiddos, and ice cream from Delaney’s Ice Cream Shoppe—featuring their usual favorite flavors and special fall flavors (available for purchase). Plus—Amazing Popcorn will be on-site serving their delicious homemade kettle corn! As dusk falls, bring your blankets or lawn chairs and settle in for a Halloween movie under the stars, plus even more festive surprises!"
Spooky Halloween Walk
- Cascade River Walk
- Tuesday, October 14th from 7 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "Bring your ghouls and goblins to the River Walk here in Cascade, IA for the Story Walk story and treats. Library Staff will be walking along and reading with a reward at the end of the walk."
Trick-or-Treat Bash
- Kennedy Mall, Dubuque
- Saturday, October 25th from 12 p.m. to 2 p.m.
- "Kids are invited to trick-or-treat throughout the mall and collect candy from participating stores. Along with candy galore, families can enjoy face painting, scavenger hunts, and other festive activities, all in a safe, family-friendly, and climate-controlled space. This event is free to attend and no sign-up is required."
Ghoul's Night Out
- Downtown Dyersville
- Thursday, October 30th from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "Stroll the streets of downtown Dyersville-- Shop, browse and enjoy a night out on the town with participating businesses. Costumes encouraged."
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- Wendt Regional Cancer Center, Dubuque
- Thursday, October 16th from 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.
- Kava Kava, Dubuque
- Friday, October 17th from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- Dubuque County Fairgrounds
- Thursday, October 23rd from 5:30 p.m. to 7 p.m. - $1 per person
- Crescent Community Health Center, Dubuque
- Friday, October 24th from 6:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m.
- St. Francis Xavier Elementary, Dyersville
- Sunday, October 26th from 3 to 4:30 p.m.
- Romper Room Childcare Center, Dubuque
- Sunday, October 26th from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m.
- Goose & Giggles Play Cafe, Dubuque
- Sunday, November 2nd from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.
FLOYD COUNTY
Eyes in the Night
- Tosanak Recreation Area, Marble Rock
- Saturday, October 11th from 7 p.m. to 9 p.m.
- "Enjoy a hayrack ride through the woods of the Tosanak Recreation Area discovering why there is 'No Place Like Home'. Fun for the entire family . . . pumpkin bowling, 'eyes' scavenger hunt, cookie decorating, and much more!"
- Registration required HERE
SpookWalk
- Charles St, Charles City
- Monday, October 27th from 4:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.
GRUNDY COUNTY
Falloween Fest
- Dike City Park
- Saturday, October 11th from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m.
Pumpkinfest
- Downtown Conrad
- Thursday, October 23rd from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- Featuring pumpkin decorating, Chalk the Walk voting, hay rides, trick-or-treating, and more
HENRY COUNTY
Broomsticks & Brews
- Downtown Mount Pleasant
- Friday, October 10th from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "It's time to put on your witch's hat, grab your broomstick & head downtown for a night of FUN!! $15 gets you a witch's hat and a cup to take along to all the retailers for your brews!"
Witch Way to Main
- Downtown Mount Pleasant
- Thursday, October 23rd from 4:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.
- "Come trick-or-treat our Main Street retailers and businesses. It is a fun event for all ages, with activities in the park, as well."
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- Waterworks Campground, Mount Pleasant
- Friday, October 10th at 10 a.m.
IOWA COUNTY
Halloween Party
- Amana Performing Arts Center
- Friday, October 31st from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m.
- Featuring face painting, live music from Winifred and the UNDEAD, a costume contest, and more
JACKSON COUNTY
Night Hike & Harvest Moon Hoorah
- Oakland Mill & Prairie Creek Recreation Area, Maquoketa
- Saturday, October 4th from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m.
- "Enjoy a bonfire, s’mores, hot cider & cocoa at Oakland Mill. As the Harvest Moon rises, Conservation Staff Jess Wagner will lead a Night Hike at Prairie Creek, starting at 6:45 PM"
Night at the Museum- Terror at CLINTON ENGINES
- Clinton Engines Site, Maquoketa
- October 10th & 11th and 17th & 18th
- Museum Ghost Tours from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- Machine Shed Haunted House from 7 p.m. to 9 p.m.
- Tickets are $7 for the museum, $7 for the Haunted Shed, or $10 for both
Pumpkins & Princesses
- Maquoketa Brewing Event Space
- Sunday, October 19th from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.
- "Join us for an enchanted afternoon filled with crafts, royal makeovers, nail painting, pumpkins, treats, and more! Costumes are encouraged, and every little princess will leave with a goodie bag fit for royalty."
- Purchase tickets HERE
Halloween Nature Crafts
- Hurstville Interpretive Center, Maquoketa
- Sunday, October 19th from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m.
- "Bats, ghosts, and pumpkins, oh my! All ages welcome for this make and take halloween craft session! Come get creative and make your very own halloween decorations using things found in nature! All craft supplies will be provided, including the pieces from nature. Participants are welcome to bring their own nature elements to spookify!"
- Registration is encouraged
BFM Halloween Party
- Westside Park, Preston
- Sunday, October 19th from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- "...join us for a costume parade along the Westside Park walk path at 4:15, followed by a free will donation hot dog meal from the Lions Club, music by Momma J, a petting zoo and more!"
Halloween Spooktacular Masquerade Ball
- Fraternal Order of the Eagles, Maquoketa
- Saturday, November 1st from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m.
- Featuring food, live music, karaoke, a costume contest, tarot card readings, and more
- Tickets are $25 in advance or $30 at the door
JEFFERSON COUNTY
The Witches Ride
- Central Park, Fairfield
- Saturday, October 11th at 7 p.m.
- "We'll be cycling approximately 7 miles through scenic routes, creating a bewitching parade of cyclists under the evening sky. Whether you're a seasoned cyclist or just looking for a fun way to embrace your inner witch, this ride is perfect for all skill levels. Costumes encouraged."
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- ISU Extension and Outreach, Fairfield
- Saturday, October 25th from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
JOHNSON COUNTY
For Johnson & Linn County Events click HERE!
JONES COUNTY
Spook Parade & Treats on the Streets
- Main Street, Anamosa
- Thursday, October 16th from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
- "Join us as we parade down Main Street, showing off costumes big and small. Local businesses and community members will be lining the street to cheer you on! Once the parade wraps up, the fun continues! Our downtown businesses will be out with candy, snacks, and goodies for the kids—so bring your treat bags and get ready to fill them up."
Haunted Trail (Public)
- Camp Courageous, Monticello
- Friday, October 17th from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m.
- Free will donations accepted
- Golf & zipline open for $10 per person
Olin Haunted Trail
- Grantwood Trail, Olin
- October 17th, 18th, 24th, & 25th
- Light Fright from 6:30 to 7:30 p.m.
- Haunted Trail from 8 p.m. to 11 p.m.
- $5 per person
Anamosa Halloween Bar Crawl
- Main Street, Anamosa
- Anamosa Bowling Center & Alley 9 Lounge
- Boondocks
- Las Brasas
- Tyler and Downey’s Eatery
- Tucker's Tavern
- Saturday, October 18th from 2 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- Featuring drink specials, raffles, games, and "fun surprises"
- Ages 21+
- Purchase your stein HERE
Trunk-or-Treats (Public Welcome)
- St Paul Lutheran Church, Anamosa
- Sunday, October 26th from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.
LINN COUNTY
For Johnson & Linn County Events click HERE!
MARSHALL COUNTY
Park Apocalypse - Zombie Run 5k
- Grimes Farm and Conservation Center, Marshalltown
- Saturday, October 18th from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m.
- "Runners will brave the oncoming night and undead creatures lurking the trails, which will try to steal their brains (also known as flags, from the flag football belts). If runners cross the finish line with flags, they have avoided lively decompositions and declared a survivor. Those with no flags, their future is not guaranteed, and they are deemed infected."
- Register online HERE
Haunt the Block
- Downtown Marshalltown
- Thursday, October 23rd from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.
- "Downtown businesses will open their doors to costumed trick-or-treaters, offering candy and treats in a safe, family-friendly environment. Families can also enjoy festive storefronts, creative costumes, and the lively energy of Marshalltown’s historic district during one of its most cherished fall traditions."
Trick-or-Treating
- Accura HealthCare of Marshalltown
- Wednesday, October 29th from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m.
MUSCATINE COUNTY
Halloween at Saulsbury
- Saulsbury Bridge Recreation Area, Muscatine
- Saturday, October 18th from 6:30 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "Visitors will follow a drive through the campground at Saulsbury Bridge Recreation Area where the campsites and other areas will be decorated with a Halloween theme (not scary) by campers."
- Suggested $10 per vehicle donation for the Muscatine County Conservation Foundation
- The first 300 kids ages 2 to 12 will receive a treat bag
Community Trick or Treat
- Pearl City Place, Muscatine
- Friday, October 31st at 5 p.m.
SCOTT COUNTY
Howl-O-Ween in the Park
- Centennial Park, Davenport
- Saturday, October 4th from 12 p.m. to 2 p.m.
- Featuring pet goods and services, a Doggie Brew Tasting Station, a treat-filled ball pit, a selfie station, animal rescue organizations, vendors, food, a costume contest, and more
Pumpkin Dash
- Credit Island Lodge, Davenport
- Sunday, October 19th at 9 a.m.
- Featuring an 8k run, a 4k run/walk, and kids' costume races
- Register online HERE
4th Annual Village Zombie Run 5k
- Duck Creek Park, Davenport
- Saturday, October 25th at 10 a.m.
- 1/2 Mile Kids Run at 8:45 a.m.
- "This point-to-point, timed downhill race kicks off at Duck Creek Park (near the tennis courts) and winds its way through Belle Avenue, a spooky stretch of Elm Street, and down Jersey Ridge—finishing triumphantly in the heart of the Village of East Davenport. Zombie vibes & Halloween costumes encouraged!"
- Register online HERE
Dwyer & Michaels Halloween Masquerade Ball
- Mississippi Valley Fairgrounds, Davenport
- Saturday, October 25th from 6 p.m. to 11:45 p.m.
- Featuring live music, free food, a costume contest, and more
- Purchase tickets HERE
NoogieFest: Free Community Trick or Treating
- Gilda's Club, Davenport
- Saturday, October 25th from 3 p.m. to 5 p.m.
- "Head to Gilda's Club Davenport for indoor trick or treating, snacks, door prizes, entertainment and more. Costumes are highly encouraged!"
Dogtober Day
- K&K Hardware & Lumber, Bettendorf
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
- "Bring your dog in costume (or any well-behaved pet!) and enter our costume contest! Contestants will be photographed in our seasonal photobooth, and winners will be chosen by votes on social media and will receive a prize (to be announced)! We’ll also be welcoming some amazing local groups, including Pack Tactics Positive Dog Training and On the Run Pet Rescue. Just Us & Treats will be here serving delicious treats!"
Trick or Treat at Hy-Vee
- Locations
- Devils Glen Rd, Bettendorf
- W Locust St, Davenport
- W Kimberly Rd, Davenport
- E 53rd St, Davenport
- North Scott, Eldridge
- Saturday, October 25th from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.
LeClaire Witches' Walk & Costume Contest
- LeClaire Civic Center
- Saturday, October 25th from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.
- Featuring trick or treating, games, balloon animals, a fire truck, and a costume contest
Tricks-N-Treats at the Figge
- Figge Art Museum, Davenport
- Sunday, October 26th from 12 p.m. to 2 p.m.
- Featuring treats, crafts, and photo ops

Halloweenapalooza

Halloween at Mini Mushrooms
- Mini Mushrooms, Ottumwa
- Friday, October 24th from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.
- "Have your child wear a costume, we will be voting on which one we like the best. The winner will win a free 1 month membership! The playroom will be decorated with Halloween decorations and there will be Halloween crafts available to make as well as Miss Ally doing fun experiments with the kids. Halloween treats will be for sale as well!"
- All activities are included in the daily play rate
WASHINGTON COUNTY
Halloween Hike
- Washington County Conservation Education Center, Ainsworth
- Saturday, October 11th at 6 p.m.
- "Go on a hike through the wilderness to discover the many animals living there. Have you ever wondered why some animals look and behave differently than others? How mystifying! Enter the trail to discover the truth behind this mystery. Along the way, there will be games and goodies. The hike will begin and end at the Conservation Education Center, where families are invited to enjoy refreshments."
Trick or Treat on the Square
- Downtown Washington
- Friday, October 31st from 5 p.m. to 6 p.m.
WINNESHIEK COUNTY
Witches Night Out
- Downtown Decorah
- Thursday, October 16th from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.
- "This is a free, walkable, downtown event open to all featuring Halloween special events, promotions, unique concoctions, and fun pop-ups. Grab your favorite friends, wear your favorite witchy ensemble, and get fully into the spooky spirit!For extra fun, plan ahead and BUY A WITCH SWAG BAG from the Decorah Area Chamber to get into the spirit of the night and enjoy a fun night out with friends!"
Welcome to the Playhouse: NMP Haunted House
- New Minowa Players Theatre, Decorah
- October 31st & November 1st from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m.
- "Step inside the New Minowa Players Theatre and discover what lurks behind the curtains. Our historic playhouse will be transformed into a chilling labyrinth where the spirits of actors past never left the stage. See if you can make it to the final curtain call…or if you’ll become part of the show forever."
- Cost is $10 per person
